name: evasiveness
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act of giving an answer that is not direct or clear, especially because you do not want to give an honest answer: People intentionally use evasiveness to avoid answering hard questions. Her evasiveness only increased his annoyance.
the act of doing something or of moving in a particular way to avoid something happening, especially something bad : The new aircraft cannot match the speed or evasiveness of the older plane. The player’s evasiveness, skill, and speed make her an asset to the team. See
evasive
More examplesFewer examplesA person could tell a truth with sufficient evasiveness to avoid revealing what he wants to keep hidden.His evasiveness feels at odds with the bold songs he's written.Offensive precision and defensive evasiveness are strong indicators of a fighter's prowess in this sport.
